reviewText: Good concert footage. Not one of the best concerts ever but pretty good.Levon's voice never really recovered from his cancer surgery. Surely he was one ofRock's best vocalists before the cancer sticks got him. Damn!Another career ruined by the use of cigarettes. Take a lesson kids.Listen UP.  x
Title: Levon Helm: Ramble At the Ryman

reviewText: Good performances by the supporting cast who obviously hold Levon in high regard.We miss you Levon. Thanks for the music.
Title: Levon Helm: Ramble At the Ryman

reviewText: This concert dvd filmed at the famous Nashville's Historic Ryman Auditorium on September 17, 2008, contains some excellent "Roots Music", including some blues, a Carter Family Song (No Depression in Heaven), several songs written by Robbie Robertson Of "The Band" (in which Levon Helm was a member), plus some more traditional "rootsy" songs. The Levon Helm Band in this concert dvd is fairly large, and you get all kinds of musical instruments played, including horns. Levon plays the drums, and mandolin, and also sings lead vocals on most songs. Plus, you get terrific Guest Artists, including: Sam Bush, Sheryl Crow, John Haitt, Buddy Miller, George Receli and Billy Bob Thornton.All the songs are great, but I really enjoyed their version of "The Weight", which has become a classic song, covered by many artists. It was written by Robbie Robertson of "The Band".If you like "Rootsy" type music, then you'll really enjoy this one. Thanks!!!!P.S. The legendary, Levon Helm, passed away after the filming/recording of this DVD. So, that makes this dvd a little more special.
summary: Great Roots Music + Great Guest Artists = A Very Good Concert DVD!!!!!
Title: Levon Helm: Ramble At the Ryman

reviewText: ....and watch this DVD.  Blues, Country, Rock and Roll - Whatever - This video is toe tapping fun.  I hesitated to buy this DVD, because I was not familiar with all the songs and musicians, but after viewing it, my hesitation was unfounded.  Great music by all.I was impressed with the quality of the transfer, both visual and audio.  I listened to both 5.1 and stereo, but found my best option was to pick the 5.1 option on the DVD, and the 7.1 stereo option on my amp.  This way, I still had the nice surround sound and good bass, but the highs from my back four speakers also filled the room. - A win win for me.A stand out on the bass drum is during the song A Train Robbery - Your dog will run and hide and the neighbors may call to complain.  The horn section, which I am usually not a fan of, was great too.  The video runs just under 75 minutes and leaves you wanting more.  Rag Mama Rag......Overall - A keeper for multiple viewings.  NOTE:  Amazon indicates a release of the DVD in May, 2011, however the DVD I received has a 2009 date on the package and the same 2009 date in the credits.
Title: Levon Helm: Ramble At the Ryman

reviewText: levon helm a great drummer from a great band,also a great solo act. songs like Ophelia,evangeline,anna lee,with his guests like Sheryl crow, john hiatt and a good band .this dvd rocks  .
Title: Levon Helm: Ramble At the Ryman

reviewText: In homage to the late Lavon Helm, tonight I watched the DVD "Ramble at the Ryman." The concert provided one of my "best ever" musical experiences. The horn section is a joy, and every other musician in the project makes a unique contribution. There is good camera work and editing, albeit the sound is a bit sloppy. The creativity, spontaneity, genre diversity, and energy are profound. Best of all, it is obvious that everyone on the stage is loving the sharing of an unforgettable musical production.
Title: Levon Helm: Ramble At the Ryman

reviewText: Levon and his band are fantastic. A classic performance in a classic setting at the beautiful Ryman. This is what music is all about. Feeling and emotion in music and songs.
Title: Levon Helm: Ramble At the Ryman
